item.title: Illyria add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "I've always thought tests are a gift. And great tests are a great gift. To fail the test is a misfortune. But to refuse the test is to refuse the gift, and something worse, more irrevocable, than misfortune." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Lois McMaster Bujold
item.description: "Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself." -- Lois McMaster Bujold

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Fantasy is an exercise bicycle for the mind. It might not take you anywhere, but it tones up the muscles that can. Of course, I could be wrong." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Joy is to fun what the deep sea is to a puddle. Itâ€™s a feeling inside that can hardly be contained." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Always be wary of any helpful item that weighs less than its operating manual." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Insanity is catching." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I DON'T HOLD WITH CRUELTY TO CATS." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Ursula K. LeGuin
item.description: "We read books to find out who we are. What other people, real or imaginary, do and think and feel... is an essential guide to our understanding of what we ourselves are and may become." -- Ursula K. LeGuin

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description:
"The book itself is a curious artifact, not showy in its technology but complex and extremely efficient: a really neat little device, compact, often very pleasant to look at and handle, that can last decades, even centuries. It doesn't have to be plugged in, activated, or performed by a machine; all it needs is light, a human eye, and a human mind. It is not one of a kind, and it is not ephemeral. It lasts. It is reliable. If a book told you something when you were fifteen, it will tell it to you again when you're fifty, though you may understand it so differently that it seems you're reading a whole new book."
(<i>Staying Awake: Notes on the alleged decline of reading</i>, Harper's Magazine, February 2008)" -- Ursula K. Le Guin

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Matthew Prior
item.description: "Be to her virtues very kind, Be to her faults a little blind." -- Matthew Prior

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I have always felt that violence was the last refuge of the incompetent, and empty threats the last sanctuary of the terminally inept." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Illyria add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Illyria add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Illyria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Illyria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Illyria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "A man that flies from his fear may find that he has only taken a short cut to meet it." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Illyria add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "What do you fear, lady?" [Aragorn] asked. "A cage," [Ã‰owyn] said. "To stay behind bars, until use and old age accept them, and all chance of doing great deeds is gone beyond recall or desire." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
